title: Teen killed in Brazil school shooting, authorities say
description: An attack by a former student leaves a 16-year-old girl dead and another teenager wounded, Cambe city officials say.

title: Anti-corruption advocate flees Honduras after receiving threats
description: Gabriela Castellanos's departure comes after her organisation published a report accusing the government of nepotism.

title: Russia plotted to kill defector in Florida: Report
description: New York Times report details failed attempt to kill the CIA informant, resulting in 'tit for tat' diplomatic row.

title: Boris Johnson misled parliament, UK MPs overwhelmingly say
description: Johnson abruptly resigned from parliament after seeing the report, calling it a 'witch hunt'.

title: Can the African Union be part of the G20?
description: India's leader has suggested a full Group of 20 membership for the African Union.

title: South Africa leader hails ‘historic’ Ukraine peace mission
description: Ramaphosa praises the first time African leaders engaged in peace efforts 'beyond the shores of the continent'.

title: Tornadoes kill one, injure dozens as southern US faces heatwave
description: The heatwave has spurred thunderstorms, flooding and power outages from Florida to Texas, leaving 400,000 in the dark.

title: UN adopts first ‘historic’ treaty to protect high seas
description: The legally binding accord outlines rules to protect biodiversity in waters outside national boundaries.

title: DRC opposition candidate threatens to boycott December vote
description: Complaints registered about voter registration and overall electoral process ahead of legislative, presidential polls.

title: Paris Air Show kicks off with record order from India’s IndiGo
description: Airbus won the multibillion-dollar deal for single-aisle planes - the largest ever by number of aircraft.

title: Brazil’s Lula to discuss trade deal with Macron on France visit
description: Brazilian president says he plans to raise stalled trade deal between the EU and bloc of South American nations.

title: Canada’s coach calls for more resources ahead of 2026 World Cup
description: John Herdman says Canada should aim to win next World Cup, which it will co-host, but team is 'suffering financially'.

title: Search underway as Titanic tourist sub goes missing in Atlantic
description: US-based firm OceanGate Expeditions says its vessel is subject of search-and-rescue operation off Canada's Newfoundland.

title: Judge says Trump team cannot release evidence in documents case
description: Judge in the US federal case against Trump says lawyers cannot release evidence to media or on social platforms.

title: Germany, Qatar pledge tens of millions of dollars for Sudan aid
description: About 25 million people - more than half of Sudan's population - are in dire need of humanitarian assistance.

title: Moldova bans pro-Russian Shor party after months of protests
description: The party, whose MPs will retain their seats as independents, has led rallies against pro-West President Maia Sandu.

title: Does Prigozhin, Russia’s Wagner chief, have political ambitions?
description: The Wagner leader is becoming a recognisable public figure in Russia and has staked out a niche among conservatives.

title: Russia’s Navalny defends himself over ‘extremism charges’
description: The charges against the Putin critic could extend his prison sentence by decades.

title: What is Juneteenth, and what’s new this year?
description: The reckoning over race ignited by the murder of George Floyd set the stage for Juneteenth to become a US holiday.

title: UK’s Boris Johnson to be judged over lockdown-flouting parties
description: MPs prepare to vote on report that found the former premier misled Parliament as a new 'partygate' video emerges.

title: Reimagining global leadership: Not who but how
description: Navigating the 21st century requires solidarity not polarity.

title: ‘Carried 26 bodies’: More deaths in north India amid extreme heat
description: India's weather office issues red alert warning in some states, including Uttar Pradesh and Bihar.

title: Israeli forces raid Jenin refugee camp
description: Israeli forces in the occupied West Bank kill five Palestinians, including a teenager.

title: Xi, Blinken agree to stabilise US-China ties in Beijing talks
description: The two sides 'made progress', Chinese President Xi Jinping says after talks with US Secretary of State Antony Blinken.

title: Nepal capital bans Indian films amid row over Adipurush dialogues
description: Kathmandu mayor bans screening of Indian films after movie inspired by Hindu epic Ramayana sparks controversy.

title: Yemen prisoner exchange talks wrap with focus on political figure
description: The Yemeni government had threatened to abandon the UN-sponsored talks if Qahtan's case continued to be dismissed.

title: Stampede during Benin-Senegal football match kills two
description: The incident happened during a weekend qualifier game between Benin and Senegal for the Africa Cup of Nations in 2024.

title: UAE, Qatar reopen embassies after years-long diplomatic rift
description: Countries agree to restore diplomatic representation after 2017 boycott and blockade of Qatar.

title: Spain’s coach says ‘more joy to come’ after Nations League win
description: Spain beat Croatia on penalties to lift Nations League crown and end their 11-year trophy drought.

title: When are Hajj and Eid al-Adha 2023?
description: Al Jazeera takes a look at the world’s largest religious gathering Mecca sees every year.

title: Taliban slams US report on rising threats in Afghanistan
description: Taliban spokesman Zabihullah Mujahid says the country is enjoying its greatest stability of the past 40 years.

title: Mourning in Pakistan as hundreds die in Greece boat tragedy
description: Pakistani authorities arrest more than a dozen alleged human traffickers in widening manhunt after the tragedy.

title: Kuwait forms cabinet with new oil, finance and defence ministers
description: The governmental shake-up is the result of snap elections as the Gulf nation grapples with ongoing political bickering.

title: Kenya signs EU trade deal in boost to Brussels’ Africa ties
description: Kenya currently sends roughly one-fifth of all its exports to the EU, its biggest market.

title: Cyclone leaves 13 dead, thousands displaced in Brazil
description: Brazil hit by deadly weather disasters in recent years, which experts say are being made worse by climate change.

title: Six killed in spate of shootings over the weekend in the US
description: Shootings come amid rise in homicides over the past years which accelerated during the COVID pandemic, experts say.

title: Cleaning Qatar’s windows: It’s not a job for the faint of heart
description: Doha's 'spidermen' are highly skilled technicians who can do nearly anything at great heights.

title: Muslims opposed to LGBTQ curricula for their kids aren’t bigots
description: It boils down to moral values rooted firmly in one’s faith, not in a political ideology — left or right.

title: Planting Azolla empowers Jordan’s women farmers
description: A farming collective of Syrian and Jordanian women in water-poor Mafraq is growing Azolla and changing their lives.

title: Five killed, at least 91 wounded in Israeli raid on Jenin camp
description: At least 91 people wounded and five dead, one of those killed is a 15-year-old boy.

title: Thailand to host meeting to ‘fully re-engage’ Myanmar’s generals
description: Indonesia, Malaysia decline invite as critics condemn Thai effort, saying it undermines regional peace initiatives.

title: Blinken makes ‘baby steps’ in bid to revive US-China ties
description: Top US diplomat holds talks with Wang Yi in Beijing amid reports he might also meet with President Xi Jinping.

title: Australia sets stage for landmark Indigenous rights referendum
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese urges a 'yes' vote in referendum on constitutional recognition for Aboriginal people.

title: North Korea calls botched spy satellite launch ‘gravest failure’
description: Pyongyang vows to launch a spy satellite soon after 'heavily criticising' those in charge of the first failed attempt.

title: Russia blocks UN aid for Kakhovka dam collapse victims
description: Massive flooding caused by dam breach has contaminated drinking water and led to bans on swimming and eating seafood.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 481
description: As the war enters its 481st day, these are the main developments.
